text: Daniel Clarence Quinn (October 11, 1935 â€“ February 17, 2018) was an American writer of novels and sociology-political commentary. He was born in 1935 during the Great Depression. He also is known for coining the term Food Race to describe the human overpopulation crisis of modern times.Dawei, Bei. "Daniel Quinn on Religion: Saving the World through Anti-Globalism?." Experiencing Globalization: Religion in Contemporary Contexts (2014): 43-58. ==References== ==Further reading== * ==Other websites== *Ishmael.org *Friends of Ishmael Society * * Category:American novelists Category:1935 births Category:2018 deaths
